metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3979 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: A remote denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the way the Nouveau Display Driver (the default Ubuntu Nvidia display driver) handles GPU shader execution. A specially crafted pixel shader can cause remote denial-of-service issues. An attacker can provide a specially crafted website to trigger this vulnerability. This vulnerability can be triggered remotely after the user visits a malformed website. No further user interaction is required. Vulnerable versions include Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (linux 4.15.0-29-generic x86_64), Nouveau Display Driver NV117 (vermagic: 4.15.0-29-generic SMP mod_unload).

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2019-05-06, no fix available

criterions.comment: xserver-xorg-video-nouveau: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
